name: sfchronicle
text: As of today, San Mateo is the only Bay Area county not on the state’s coronavirus watch list. But that could change soon, and beauty salons, houses of worship, and other indoor businesses are trying to hang onto a small sense of normalcy. https://t.co/LkLfjoCzBB

name: sfchronicle
text: There were 997 infected prisoners at San Quentin as of Saturday, a drop from 1,118 on Friday, prison officials reported. The prison has seen 452 new cases over the past 14 days, and has reported recorded 12 deaths so far from COVID-19. https://t.co/MRNec6ZXMR

name: sfchronicle
text:
Giants relief pitcher Tony Watson, overcoming a shoulder issue, appeared in his first intrasquad game Friday and said he’ll be comfortable to pitch in Thursday’s season opener at Dodger Stadium.

https://t.co/MnfAUlLXDL

name: sfchronicle
text: A large new study from South Korea finds that children younger than 10 transmit to others much less often than adults do, but the risk is not zero. And those between the ages of 10 and 19 can spread the virus at least as well as adults do. https://t.co/ZIYZc7Qlqp

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @SFC_Datebook: #HunterSThompson would have turned 83 today. Thompson’s longtime editor looks back on a tumultuous collaboration — and what might have been. #BOTD
https://t.co/7R80fGmADC

name: sfchronicle
text: San Francisco City Hall will be illuminated in red, white and blue tonight in honor of Rep. John Lewis, the civil rights icon who died on Friday at age 80. The city will also lower its flags to half-staff to honor the congressman. https://t.co/xvaFib3Z5E

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here's the latest on the #MineralFire in Fresno County:

- 24,600 acres burned 
- 35% contained
- 4 structures destroyed
- No reported injuries 

Follow our Fire Tracker for more: https://t.co/cx9uhh8AEE https://t.co/2RtV7GpS2U

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Francisco City Hall is illuminated in red, white and blue tonight in honor of Rep. John Lewis, the civil rights icon who died on Friday at age 80. The city will lower its flags to half-staff to honor the congressman. 

Story: https://t.co/qHeVKk9GFb

Photo: @SantiagoMejia https://t.co/627M1Ozfuy

name: sfchronicle
text: To crack down on fires caused by power lines, the California Public Utilities Commission has a new fire safety division to conduct field inspections of PG&E and other electric companies. https://t.co/gXAzXUGjLQ
